issue.title: Google Drive (encrypted): "failed to authenticate decrypted block - bad password?" on files during reading

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone 1.35

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Devuan Linux 1.0 (systemd-free fork of Debian Jessie).

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google Drive, with the built-in rclone encryption.

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone -v --dump-headers --log-file=LOGFILE copy egd:REDACTED/REDACTED/REDACTED/REDACTED.mp4 /tmp/REDACTED.mp4
`
 

> A log from the command with the `-v` flag (eg output from `rclone -v copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

Please find it attached: [LOGFILE.txt](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/691515/LOGFILE.txt)

Note 1: This is related to #677, which is closed and I cannot reopen.
Note 2: These errors are 100% reproducible.

Cheers, 
   Durval.

body: I'll probably do this with a flag `--crypt-show-mapping` which in combination with `-v` will show the mapping of crypted files to unencrypted files whenever they are listed.  So this could be used with `rclone ls` or `rclone sync` etc.

I've just implemented this - please find the beta here

http://beta.rclone.org/v1.35-46-g390f3cf/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Warning on a possible "documentation regression": the "--crypt-show-mapping" option isn't in the docs on the last rclone beta I downloaded:

```
grep -i show-mapping rclone-v1.35-99-g6fc114d??-linux-amd64/rclone.1
      -> Shows nothing.

rclone-v1.35-99-g6fc114d??-linux-amd64/rclone --help 2>&1 | grep -i show-mapping
      --crypt-show-mapping                For all files listed show how the names encrypt.
```

I saw on the commit above that  docs/content/crypt.md was updated with an entry documenting this, and I *think* that this file (along with the other .md files) are used to generate the manpage I checked above, so this is why I'm calling this a "documentation regression".

Cheers, 
   Durval.

@DurvalMenezes that will get sorted out when I make the release.  Unfortunately the betas come out with the old docs due to the way they are made.  I should probably work out how to fix that!  Thanks for reporting.

Hello @ncw,

Just reporting back, I had the opportunity to use `--crypt-show-mapping` and it worked great; much better than try to divine the file/dir names by looking at the GDrive web interface. 

Cheers, 
   Durval.

Hi @ncw, 

> @DurvalMenezes :-)

LOL, I'm serious ;-) What I did before `--crypt-show-mapping` was to find an encrypted directory with the exact number of files and subdirectories as the one I was looking for, and then looking for a file in it with the exact size. That was a lot of work, but usually successful... anyway, with the new option this has become much easier and faster.

Cheers, 
   Durval.
